newsitem.title: UK: Clarke says to crack down on VAT "wheezes".
newsitem.headline: Clarke says to crack down on VAT "wheezes".

text.p: UK Chancellor Kenneth Clarke said on Tuesday his budget included a crackdown on "some of the clever wheezes" that he said had sprung up to get around paying Value Added Tax.
He said the moves would raise 750 million pounds in revenue next year, but would also protect a further 1.5 billion pounds of existing revenue from further attack.
He said in his budget presentation that Customs and Excise would restrict access to special VAT schemes for retailers and tighten up rules on VAT relief schemes.
"I also propose to take steps against retailers who reduce their VAT bills when selling insurance with their products," he added.
He said the Customs' right to backdate VAT claims should be restricted to three years.
